name: Changelog manager
tagline: Helps generate high quality CHANGELOG.md entries without constant conflicts.
body:
Change logs are an invaluable, and often neglected part of _any_ software project.

A good changelog helps you users to understand: 
* Why they should care about your latest version
* If any of your changes affect the problems or frustrations they've been having.
* If there are any changes that might affect how they use your app / library. 
* Why your efforts are worth their continued support.

[changelog_manager](https://github.com/masukomi/changelog_manager) is a tool that makes it easy to generate high quality Changelog files that your users will want to read. Not [auto-generated :poop: from git commits](http://weblog.masukomi.org/2016/06/30/why-you-cant-auto-generate-your-changelog/).  

It encourages developers to create changelog entries at the correct level of abstraction, and it avoids the constant conflicts that would be generated my manually committing changes to CHANGELOG.md.

For more details, check out [the README](https://github.com/masukomi/changelog_manager#readme). If you still have questions please ask @masukomi (the creator) at [@masukomi on Twitter](https://twitter.com/masukomi).
